Title: Update on Medical Practices That Should Be Questioned in 2015
Summary: Reviews overused medical practices, focusing on unnecessary screening and overtreatment.

Title: 2016 Update on Medical Overuse: A Systematic Review
Summary: Systematic review highlighting overuse of tests, treatments, and services.

Title: 2018 Update on Medical Overuse
Summary: Reviews 2017 data on medical overuse and its potential harms.

Title: 2019 Update on Medical Overuse: A Review
Summary: Synthesizes 2018 findings showing that unnecessary care remains common and harmful.

Title: Publishing Ethics and Predatory Practices: A Dilemma for All Stakeholders
Summary: Discusses predatory publishing and its implications for scientific communication.

Title: Predatory Journals Spamming for Publications: What Should Researchers Do?
Summary: Examines tactics used by predatory journals and offers guidance for researchers.

Title: Impact of a Biomarker-Based Strategy on Oncology Drug Development
Summary: Meta-analysis of biomarker-guided oncology trials and their effect on drug approvals.
Organization: Journal of the National Cancer Institute

Title: Long-Term Overall Survival and Prognostic Score Predicting Survival: the IMPACT Study in Precision Medicine
Summary: Develops a prognostic score for survival outcomes in precision oncology.

Title: Machine Learning: Trends, Perspectives, and Prospects
Summary: Discusses machine learning's growth, foundational theory, and broad applications.

Title: Deep Learning
Summary: Comprehensive deep learning survey covering breakthroughs in AI applications like vision and genomics.

Title: Deep Learning for Computational Biology
Summary: Reviews applications of deep learning in genomics and cellular imaging; guides best practices for use.

Title: Deep Neural Nets as a Method for Quantitative Structure–Activity Relationships
Summary: Demonstrates that deep neural networks outperform random forests in QSAR predictions.
Organization: Journal of Chemical Information and Modeling

Title: A Study on the Application and Use of Artificial Intelligence to Support Drug Development
Summary: Survey on AI adoption in pharmaceutical R&D across institutions.

Title: Artificial Intelligence and Collusion
Summary: Explores how AI may facilitate tacit collusion; analyzes legal/policy implications.

Title: Disease Inference from Health-Related Questions via Sparse Deep Learning
Summary: Examines bias learned via deep learning from unstructured health queries.

Title: Computer-Aided Diagnosis with Deep Learning Architecture: Applications to Breast Lesion in US Images and Pulmonary Nodule in CT Scans
Summary: Study of DL-based CAD to distinguish benign/malignant lesions in ultrasound and CT.

Title: Breast Cancer Classification Using Deep Belief Network
Summary: CAD scheme using DBN - a NN on the Wisconsin dataset for breast cancer detection.
Tags: deep belief network, CAD, breast cancer

Title: Regulate Artificial Intelligence to Avert Cyber Arms Race
Summary: Editorial advocating for AI regulation to prevent cyber conflict escalation.

Title: Battling Artificial Intelligence in Cybersecurity: A Double-Edged Sword
Summary: Reflects on AI’s dual potential to protect and compromise security.

Title: A Survey on Deep Learning in Medical Image Analysis
Summary: Reviews 300+ DL applications in medical imaging.

Title: Deep Learning in Medical Image Analysis
Summary: Reviews deep learning foundations and applications in medical imaging.

Title: A Comparative Study for Chest Radiograph Image Retrieval using Binary, Texture and Deep Learning Classification
Summary: Compare chest X-ray retrieval using different classification methods.
Tags: Chest X-ray, image retrieval, deep learning

Title: Using Dense Convolutional Networks for Interstitial Lung Diseases
Summary: Classifies lung diseases with DCN.

Title: Multi-Loss Convolutional Networks for Gland Analysis in Microscopy
Summary: Proposes CNN architecture with multiple loss functions to improve gland segmentation in histopathology images.
Tags: deep learning, gland segmentation, histopathology, microscopy

Title: Training and Validating a Deep Convolutional Neural Network for Computer-Aided Detection and Classification of Abnormalities on Chest Radiographs
Summary: CAD trained and validated on a large dataset. Deep CNN used to read chest X-rays and classify abnormalities.
Tags: deep learning, chest radiography, CNN classification

Title: Densely-Connected Prostate Segmentation via Deep Feature Learning and Sparse Patch Matching
Summary: Proposes an ML prostate segmentation method combining deep feature learning with sparse patch matching.

Title: Brain tumor segmentation with Deep Neural Networks
Summary: Medical Image Analysis article on DNN methods for tumor segmentation.

Title: Anthropogenic Climate Change Affects Meteorological Drought Risk in Europe
Summary: Investigates how human-induced climate change has altered drought risk across Europe.

Title: Climate Change and the New Normal for Air Quality
Summary: Reviews climate change's impact on respiratory health.

Title: Impacts of Climate Change on Future Air Quality and Human Health in China
Summary: Links climate events to air pollution and health risks.

Title: Health impact of climate change in cities of middle-income countries: the case of China
Summary: Review of climate-change health impacts in Chinese cities (heat, rainfall, sea-level rise, extreme weather) and implications for similar middle-income settings.
Tags: climate change, public health, China, urban health

Title: Bioenergy and climate change mitigation: an assessment
Summary: Cross-disciplinary assessment of bioenergy’s mitigation potential, risks, sustainability, and BECCS pathways.

Title: Projection methods for large-scale T-Sylvester equations
Summary: Efficient Krylov-based projection methods to solve large T-Sylvester matrix equations arising in control and PDEs.
Tags: numerical linear algebra, Sylvester equations, Krylov methods

Title: A posteriori error estimates for stabilized finite element approximations of the Navier–Stokes equations
Summary: A posteriori error estimates for stabilized FEM solutions of Navier–Stokes; analysis and applications.
Tags: finite elements, Navier–Stokes, a posteriori error

Title: Mathematics education and machine learning
Summary: Editorial on opportunities and caveats at the math-education/ML interface.

Title: A Review of Machine Learning in Mathematical Modeling
Summary: Review of ML techniques supporting mathematical modeling problems; open access.

Title: On some problems of mathematical education
Summary: Survey-style article (translation issue) on questions in mathematics education.

Title: Influencing the practice of chemistry education
Summary: Editorial on translating chemistry-education research into classroom practice; open access.

Title: Accurate quantum chemical energies for 133 000 organic molecules
Summary: Provides G4MP2 benchmark energies for the GDB-9 set; useful dataset for ML and thermochemistry.
Tags: quantum chemistry, G4MP2, datasets, machine learning

Title: The role of nanotechnology in the development of battery materials for electric vehicles
Summary: Review of how nanostructuring improves EV battery materials (energy density, stability, kinetics).

Title: A lithium–oxygen battery based on lithium superoxide
Summary: Demonstrates stabilization of crystalline LiO₂ in a Li–O₂ cell using graphene-based cathodes; implications for Li-air chemistry.

Title: Nanostructured transition-metal dichalcogenide electrocatalysts for CO₂ reduction in ionic liquid
Summary: TMD nanostructures catalyze electrochemical CO₂→CO efficiently in ionic liquids.

Title: Quantum-Chemical Characterization of the Properties and Reactivities of Metal–Organic Frameworks
Summary: Comprehensive review of electronic-structure approaches for MOFs (structure, adsorption, catalysis, reactivity).

Title: Model space diabatization for quantum photochemistry
Summary: Diabatization strategy to obtain diabatic states for photochemical problems (JCP 142, 064106).

Title: Density Functional Theory of the Water Splitting Reaction on Transition-Metal Catalysts
Summary: DFT analysis of mechanisms and energetics for catalytic water splitting on transition-metal surfaces.

Title: Sulfur-Functionalization of Metal–Organic Frameworks and Investigation of their Catalytic Activity in the Conversion of CO2
Summary: Review on sulfur-functionalized MOFs: synthesis, characterization, catalytic applications in CO2 conversion.

Title: Selective Catalytic Hydrogenation of Nitrogen-Containing Heteroaromatics with Nanoscale Co Catalysts
Summary: Co-based catalysts hydrogenate nitrogen heteroaromatics selectively under mild conditions.

Title: Light-Triggered Reversible Structural Changes in Metal–Organic Frameworks
Summary: MOFs undergo reversible structural change upon light irradiation, providing photo-switchable functionality.

Title: Education 4.0: Technology-Enhanced Learning in Higher Education
Summary: Review of digital technologies in education and their impact on learning outcomes.

Title: Dimensions and Influence of Hospital Physical Environments on Patients’ Well-being
Summary: Examines hospital physical environment impact on patient recovery and well-being.

Title: Online Remote Monitoring of Implantable Medical Devices
Summary: Explains remote monitoring systems for implanted devices improving patient safety and care.

Title: Assessment of the Rehabilitation of Stroke Patients using Wearable Sensors
Summary: Wearable sensors evaluate rehabilitation progress post-stroke.

Title: Hybrid Process for Hydrogen Production from Biomass and Methane
Summary: Proposes combination of biomass gasification and methane reforming for efficient H2 production.
Tags: biomass gasification, hydrogen production, methane reforming

Title: Experimental Investigation of Reinforced Concrete Beams Strengthened with Steel Plates
Summary: Study demonstrates strengthened beams show significant load capacity improvements.

Title: Theoretical Analysis of Quantum Measurement Backaction
Summary: Theoretical analysis of measurement-induced backaction effects in quantum systems.

Title: Coherent Spin Dynamics in Diamond Defects
Summary: Review of spin dynamics in NV centers for quantum computing applications.
Tags: quantum computing, diamond defects, NV centers

Title: Optomechanical Systems for Precision Sensing
Summary: Review of optomechanical systems and their potential for high-precision sensing.

Title: Major Current for Quantum Spin Systems
Summary: Extends the Wagner current formalism to quantum spin systems.

Title: Many-Source Quantum Entanglement from Quantum Dots
Summary: Demonstrates multiple entangled photon emission from semiconductor quantum dots.

Title: Dynamics in Quantum Entanglement
Summary: Studies entanglement evolution in quantum many-body systems.

Title: Two-particle Interference in Quantum Optical Systems
Summary: Simulation of two-particle interference patterns in quantum optics.

Title: Deciphering the imprint of topology on nonlinear dynamical network stability
Summary: How network topology shapes nonlinear stability in oscillator networks (e.g., power grids).

Title: Search for pair production of second-generation leptoquarks at √s = 13 TeV
Summary: CMS search; scalar leptoquarks below ~1.53 TeV.

Title: Measurement of the pp → WZ inclusive and differential production cross sections and constraints on charged anomalous triple gauge couplings at √s = 13 TeV
Summary: CMS measures WZ cross sections (35.9 fb⁻¹) and sets limits on anomalous triple-gauge couplings; SM-consistent.

Title: Search for an Lμ − Lτ gauge boson using Z → 4μ events in proton–proton collisions at √s = 13 TeV
Summary: CMS Z' search using Z→4μ; sets coupling/mass limits (5–70 GeV).

Title: A search for pair production of new light bosons decaying into muons in proton–proton collisions at 13 TeV
Summary: CMS model-independent search; limits for 0.25–8.5 GeV bosons.

Title: Search for tt̄H production in the H → bb̄ decay channel with leptonic tt̄ decays in proton–proton collisions at √s = 13 TeV
Summary: CMS ttH (H→bb) analysis (35.9 fb⁻¹); sets μ; mild excess.

Title: Search for heavy resonances decaying into two Higgs bosons or into a Higgs boson and a W or Z boson in proton–proton collisions at 13 TeV
Summary: CMS HH and VH resonance search; excludes masses up to ~2.7–2.8 TeV for certain models.

Title: Measurement of Υ(1S) Elliptic Flow at Forward Rapidity in Pb-Pb Collisions at √sNN = 5.02 TeV
Summary: ALICE measures Υ(1S) v2; small values consistent with transport models.

Title: Coherent J/ψ photoproduction at forward rapidity in ultra-peripheral Pb–Pb collisions at √sNN = 5.02 TeV
Summary: ALICE coherent J/ψ photoproduction; constrains gluon shadowing models.

Title: Dilepton and φ meson production in elementary and nuclear collisions at the NICA fixed-target experiment
Summary: Perspective/review on how NICA fixed-target measurements of dileptons and φ mesons can fill the energy gap between SIS and SPS to constrain collision models.
Tags: NICA; dileptons; φ meson; heavy-ion collisions
Organization: Wigner Research Centre for Physics (authors: G. Wolf, M. Zétényi)

Title: Thermal electromagnetic radiation in heavy-ion collisions
Summary: Review of photons and dileptons as penetrating probes to access the electromagnetic spectral function of QCD matter across mass/momentum.
Tags: electromagnetic probes; photons; dileptons; QCD matter
Organization: Eur. Phys. J. A (R. Rapp, H. van Hees)

Title: Do hyperons exist in the interior of neutron stars?
Summary: Review of the “hyperon puzzle” in neutron-star EoS, proposed resolutions, and implications of high-mass NS observations; also cooling and r-mode effects.
Tags: neutron stars; hyperons; equation of state; hyperon puzzle

Title: Hyperon-hyperon interactions with the Nijmegen ESC08 model
Summary: Discusses YY interactions in ESC08 with coupled-channels; BHF calculations for hypernuclear matter and neutron-star structure find low maximum masses.
Tags: hyperon-hyperon; Nijmegen ESC08; Brueckner-HF; neutron stars
Organization: EPJ A (Th. A. Rijken, H.-J. Schulze)

Title: Taxation and the International Mobility of Inventors
Summary: Using inventor-panel data since 1977, shows superstar inventors’ locations respond strongly to top tax rates; estimates elasticities of domestic vs. foreign superstar counts.

Title: Buy, Keep, or Sell: Economic Growth and the Market for Ideas
Summary: Endogenous growth model where firms trade ideas; characterizes when firms develop, keep, or sell innovations and implications for growth.
Tags: endogenous growth; ideas market; R&D; innovation

Title: Creative Destruction and Subjective Wellbeing
Summary: Links turnover-driven growth to wellbeing across U.S. MSAs; positive effects stronger with certain industry dynamics and UI generosity.
Tags: creative destruction; wellbeing; growth; labor turnover
Organization: NBER Working Paper (Aghion, Akcigit, Deaton, Roulet)

Title: Innovation and Top Income Inequality
Summary: Documents strong links between measures of innovation and top income shares; explores mechanisms via firm/individual-level evidence.
Organization: Review of Economic Studies (Aghion, Akcigit, Bergeaud, Blundell, Hémous)

Title: The Impact of Competition on Management Quality: Evidence from Public Hospitals
Summary: Uses plausibly exogenous variation in English hospital competition to show competition improves management quality and performance.
Organization: Review of Economic Studies (Bloom, Propper, Seiler, Van Reenen)

Title: Corporate Tax: What Do Stakeholders Expect?
Summary: Qualitative interviews (UK context) map expectations of community vs. business stakeholders on corporate tax responsibilities.
Tags: corporate tax; stakeholders; CSR; qualitative study
Organization: Journal of Business Ethics (Hillenbrand, Money, Brooks)

Title: Experience wears the trousers: Exploring gender and attitude to financial risk
Summary: Large advisory-context dataset shows women are less risk-tolerant; prior investment experience and advisor interactions help explain differences and outcomes.
Tags: gender; risk tolerance; household finance; advisors
Organization: Journal of Economic Behavior & Organization (Brooks, Sangiorgi, Hillenbrand, Money)

Title: Optimism, volatility and decision-making in stock markets
Summary: Introduces a tractable risk-decision framework incorporating optimism/pessimism; analyzes implications for trading and volatility.
Organization: International Review of Financial Analysis (F. Rocciolo)

Title: Financial data science: the birth of a new financial research paradigm complementing econometrics?
Summary: Argues financial data science complements econometrics; warns on p-hacking and inflated power with big data; advocates integrity, pre-registration, and focusing on economic/statistical relevance.
Tags: financial data science; econometrics; big data; research integrity
Organization: The European Journal of Finance (Brooks, Hoepner, McMillan, Vivian, Wese Simen)

Title: Special Section on Computer Architecture and Systems with Emerging Technologies – Preface
Summary: Preface to a special section introducing research topics on computer architecture and systems with emerging technologies, outlining included papers on memory hierarchies, cache design, GPU optimizations, and emerging computing paradigms.
Tags: computer architecture; emerging technologies; memory systems; GPUs
Organization: Journal of Computer Science and Technology (Wen-Chung Chen)

Title: The Skill-Biased Effects of Exchange Rate Fluctuations
Summary: Shows how exchange-rate movements shift firms’ skill demand; in Swiss manufacturing, appreciations raise high-skill and reduce low-skill employment.
Tags: exchange rates; skill-biased demand; trade exposure; labor

Title: Commuting and Taxes: Theory, Empirics and Welfare Implications
Summary: Interstate income-tax differences distort commuting; effects depend on residence- vs. employment-based taxation; sizeable impacts for affluent/mobile households.

Title: Labour Market Effects of International Trade When Mobility is Costly
Summary: Dynamic structural model with costly worker mobility and imperfectly transferable human capital; quantifies trade’s distributional labor-market impacts.
Tags: trade; labor mobility; human capital; structural model

Title: Higher Education and Prosperity: From Catholic Missionaries to Luminosity in India
Summary: IV strategy using historical missionary presence shows higher education raises local economic prosperity (night-lights) across Indian districts.

Title: Combination versus mono-therapy as salvage treatment for advanced biliary tract cancer
Summary: Meta-analysis assessing second-line chemo for gallbladder cancers; compares response, survival, toxicity between combo and mono-therapy.

Title: Temporal indexing of medical entity in Chinese clinical notes
Summary: Proposes RNN-CNN model to time-label medical entities in clinical text; achieves ~76% F1 in temporal relation classification.
Tags: medical NLP; temporal indexing; RNN; CNN
Organization: BMC Med Inform Decis Mak (Liu et al.)

Title: Buy, Keep, or Sell: Economic Growth and the Market for Ideas
Summary: Endogenous growth model with idea trading between firms; examines when they develop, keep, or sell innovations and impact on growth.

Title: Financial data science: the birth of a new financial research paradigm complementing econometrics?
Summary: Argues financial data science complements econometrics; warns about p-hacking with big data; calls for integrity and relevance.
Tags: financial data science; econometrics; research integrity

Title: Living with low for long
Summary: Reviews causes and implications of prolonged global real interest rate decline.

Title: Equivalence versus Indifference Scales
Summary: Introduces indifference scales as an alternative to equivalence scales to improve income comparisons across family types.

Title: Life-cycle Labour Supply with Human Capital: Econometric and Behavioural Implications
Summary: Shows that labor supply elasticity depends on both preferences and human capital returns; human capital changes wage/time trade-off.

Title: Labour Supply: The Roles of Human Capital and the Extensive Margin
Summary: Extends lifecycle labour supply model by including human capital and entry decision effects on responses to taxes.

Title: Market Set-up in Advance of Federal Reserve Policy Rate Decisions
Summary: Shows that futures markets anticipate FOMC decisions; macro news/testimonies affect market more than speeches.

Title: Do Personality Traits Affect Productivity? Evidence from the Laboratory
Summary: Lab experiment shows neurotic individuals perform worse; conscientious better—personality impacts productivity.

Title: Universal Pre-school Education: The Case of Public Funding with Private Provision
Summary: Free preschools increased early gains, but effects fade by age 11; private provision may compensate.

Title: Do Professionals Get It Right? Limited Attention and Risk...
Summary: Athletes display left-digit bias interpreting signals. Cognitive bias persists even under pressure.

Title: A university‑based model for supporting computer science curriculum reform
Summary: Describes Technocamps outreach in Wales; addresses barriers and creates scalable curriculum support.

Title: Is computing for social good the solution to closing the gender gap in computer science?
Summary: Reviews using social-good examples to reduce gender gap in computing education.
Tags: CS education; social good; gender gap
